org.gearvrf.physics

Class GVRRigidBody

  • java.lang.Object
    • GVRComponent
      • org.gearvrf.physics.GVRRigidBody

  • public class GVRRigidBody
extends GVRComponent
    Represents a rigid body that can be static or dynamic. You can set a mass and apply some physics forces.

    By default it is a static body with infinity mass, value 0, and does not move under simulation. A dynamic body with a mass defined is fully simulated.

    Every scene object can represent a rigid body since it has a GVRRigidBody component attached to. You must setup the values of owner's org.gearvrf.GVRTransform, like initial position, and the mass value of the rigid body before attach it to its owner.

                    float mass)

        Parameters:
        gvrContext - The context of the app.
        mass - The mass of this rigid body.

      • GVRRigidBody

        public GVRRigidBody(GVRContext gvrContext,
                    float mass,
                    int collisionGroup)
        Constructs new instance to simulate a rigid body in GVRWorld.
        Parameters:
        gvrContext - The context of the app.
        mass - The mass of this rigid body.
        collisionGroup - The id of the collision's group that this rigid body belongs to in the GVRCollisionMatrix. The rigid body collides with everyone if {#collisionGroup} is out of the range 0...15.

        public GVRWorld getWorld()
        Returns the physics world of this rigid body.
        Returns:
        The physics world of this GVRRigidBody

      • setSimulationType

        public void setSimulationType(int type)
        Establishes how this rigid body will behave in the simulation.
        Parameters:
        type - type of simulation desired for the rigid body:
        DYNAMICCollides with other objects, moved by simulation
        STATICCollides with other objects, does not move
        KINEMATICCollides with other objects, moved by application

      • getSimulationType

        public int getSimulationType()
        Queries how this rigid body will behave in the simulation.
        Returns:
        type of simulation desired for the rigid body
        DYNAMICCollides with other objects, moved by simulation
        STATICCollides with other objects, does not move
        KINEMATICCollides with other objects, moved by application
